content: hat with star decrease by snowberry & lime simple but well-fitting hat knitted in rounds with a pretty looking decrease final head circumference is about 56 5cm 22 1/4 inches ideal yarn about 50g of 50g = 92m eg lang mille colori 10cm = row 15 stitches column 23 stitches on 6mm us10 needles or about 80g of 50g = 50m on 6mm us10 needles - for a very tight knit about 100m of any similar yarn should work ideal for handspun cast on cast on 78 stitches distribute evenly on 3 needles and connect to round *knit 1 purl 1* repeat pattern between stars in rounds for about 3cm 1 ¼ inches continue in stockinette stitch knit at about 12cm 4 ¾ inches total height make sure that on each of the three needles are 26 stitches decrease in every second round knit together the last and second to last stitch on each needle and the middle stitch and the one before it for example 26 stitches on each needle k2tog stitches 12 and 13 of each needle and stitches 25 and 26 then one round of stockinette stitch followed by knit together stitches 11 and 12 of each needle and stitches 24 and 25 of each needle continue until about 6 stitches left on each needle then start decreasing in every row until only 2 stitches are left on every needle 6 stitches overall cast off cut off yarn leaving about 30cm 12 inches and sew through remaining stitches pull loose end to the inside of the hat make a knot and weave end in also weave cast on end in finished wear it and be delighted for further information please check out snowberry & lime at http //www snowberrylime com or read more at http //snowberrylime blogspot com pattern and images © 2007-2010 veronika von allmen creative commons feel free to use as you please as long as you mention snowberry & lime and link back thanks
